title: Keoladeo National Park
short_description: Formerly Bharatpur Bird Sanctuary, a UNESCO site hosting thousands of bird species including the Siberian Crane.
long_description: Keoladeo National Park, located in Bharatpur, Rajasthan, is a famous avifauna sanctuary that hosts thousands of birds, especially during the winter season. Over 370 species of birds can be seen here. It was created 250 years ago and is named after a Keoladeo (Shiva) temple within its boundaries. Initially a royal hunting reserve, it was declared a national park in 1982 and a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1985. It is a man-made and man-managed wetland and one of the richest bird areas in the world. It is known for nesting of resident birds and visiting migratory birds including water fowl and the rare Siberian crane (historic).
wildlife_significance: A man-made wetland of global importance for migratory waterfowl. Ramsar site.
guides_and_tips: Rickshaw pullers are trained bird guides; highly recommended. Renting a bicycle is also a great option.
how_to_reach: By Air: Agra (56 km) or Delhi (180 km). By Rail: Bharatpur Junction (5 km).
permits_and_fees: Tickets available at the main gate. Guide hiring is separate.
conservation_notes: Invasive species (Prosopis juliflora) removal and water management are key challenges.
sample_itinerary: Day 1: Arrive Bharatpur. Afternoon Rickshaw Safari till sunset. Day 2: Early morning boat ride (if water level permits). Cycling tour. Visit Lohagarh Fort in town. Departure.
safety_tips: Watch out for pythons basking on tracks. Carry binoculars.

operating_season.off_season: May to June (Too hot, fewer birds)
operating_season.season_notes: Monsoon (August-Sept) is good for breeding resident birds.

pricing_metadata.disclaimer: Rickshaw rates are regulated by park management.
